title: Caleb's Inheritance
shortSummary: Joshua 14 records the distribution of the land of Canaan among the tribes of Israel, fulfilling God's promise to His people. It highlights Caleb's faithfulness and courage, resulting in his receiving Hebron as his inheritance. This chapter underscores God's faithfulness to His promises and the reward of wholehearted obedience.
timeline: c. 1406 BC - The Conquest and Division of Canaan

keyCharacters.name: Joshua
keyCharacters.description: The leader of Israel who succeeded Moses and oversaw the distribution of the Promised Land.

keyCharacters.name: Caleb
keyCharacters.description: A faithful spy and warrior of the tribe of Judah who wholly followed the LORD and received Hebron as his inheritance.

keyCharacters.name: Eleazar
keyCharacters.description: The high priest who assisted in the distribution of the land among the tribes of Israel.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The servant of the LORD who originally commanded the land distribution and promised Caleb his inheritance.

definitions.definition: A method used to fairly distribute land or possessions by casting lots, signifying God's sovereign choice.
A race of giants in Canaan known for their great size and strength, representing formidable enemies.
A clan or family group to which Caleb belonged, indicating his distinct heritage within Judah.
The land or possession given by God to His people as a fulfillment of His covenant promises.

outline.heading: Distribution of the Land
outline.description: The chapter opens with the priests, Joshua, and tribal leaders distributing the land of Canaan by lot as commanded by the LORD through Moses, ensuring an orderly and divinely guided inheritance.

outline.heading: Caleb’s Reminder of God’s Promise
outline.description: Caleb approaches Joshua to remind him of the promise God made through Moses that the land he walked on would be his inheritance because of his wholehearted faithfulness.

outline.heading: Caleb’s Request and Strength
outline.description: Despite his advanced age, Caleb confidently requests the mountain region of Hebron, expressing his continued strength and trust in God’s power to drive out the Anakims.

outline.heading: Caleb Receives Hebron
outline.description: Joshua blesses Caleb and grants him Hebron, fulfilling God’s promise and bringing rest to the land from war, highlighting the reward of faith and obedience.

application: Trust in God's promises even when circumstances seem difficult, knowing He is faithful to fulfill His word.
Demonstrate wholehearted obedience and faithfulness to God, as Caleb did, to receive His blessings and inheritance.
Rely on God's strength in spiritual battles, regardless of age or challenges, trusting He empowers His servants.
Encourage others by reminding them of God's faithfulness and the importance of steadfastness in the Christian walk.

keyVerses.text: And Moses sware on that day, saying, Surely the land whereon thy feet have trodden shall be thine inheritance, and thy children's for ever, because thou hast wholly followed the LORD my God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's covenant faithfulness and the reward for Caleb's wholehearted devotion.

keyVerses.text: Now therefore give me this mountain, whereof the LORD spake in that day; for thou heardest in that day how the Anakims were there, and that the cities were great and fenced: if so be the LORD will be with me, then I shall be able to drive them out, as the LORD said.
keyVerses.significance: Caleb’s confident faith in God’s power to overcome obstacles serves as an example of trusting God in the face of challenges.

keyVerses.text: Hebron therefore became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenezite unto this day, because that he wholly followed the LORD God of Israel.
keyVerses.significance: This verse confirms the lasting reward of faithfulness and obedience to God.
